greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: a(n) = 1 iff digit n+1 of Pi is >= digit n, otherwise a(n) = 0. We consider 3 to be digit 1 of Pi.
link: Reinhard Zumkeller, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..1000
Index entries for sequences related to the number Pi
formula: If A000796(n+1) >= A000796(n) then a(n)=1, otherwise a(n)=0.
a(n) = if A095916(n) < 0 then 0, otherwise 1. - _Reinhard Zumkeller_, Mar 12 2015
mathematica: nn = 100; d = RealDigits[N[Pi, nn]][[1]]; Table[Boole[d[[n + 1]] >= d[[n]]], {n, nn - 1}] (* _T. D. Noe_, Jul 29 2011 *)
results.author: _Alexander R. Povolotsky_, Jul 28 2011
